TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit ProfileEventArgs extends System.EventArgs

Docs.summary: Provides data for the event of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileEventArgs> class during the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileModule.Personalize> event to specify a custom user profile. If, when the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileModule.Personalize> event completes, the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileEventArgs> parameter of the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileEventHandler> has its <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileEventArgs.Profile%2A> property set to a value that’s not `null`, then the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileModule> uses the value of the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileEventArgs.Profile%2A> property in the current <xref:System.Web.HttpContext>.
## Examples The following code example shows the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileModule.Personalize> event declared in the Global.asax file for an application. The event code loads a user profile based on role membership.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.Profile.ProfileManager.Personalize#12](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Profile.ProfileManager.Personalize/CS/global.asax#12)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Profile.ProfileManager.Personalize#12](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Profile.ProfileManager.Personalize/VB/global.asax#12)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Web.HttpContext context) cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates an instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileEventArgs.%23ctor%2A> creates an instance of the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileEventArgs> class and sets the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileEventArgs.Context%2A> property to the specified <xref:System.Web.HttpContext>.

Docs.summary: Gets the for the current request.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileEventArgs> object provides event information to the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileModule.Personalize> event of the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileModule> class. The <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileEventArgs.Context%2A> property provides access to the <xref:System.Web.HttpContext> of the current request.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the user profile for the current request.
Docs.value: The user profile to use for the current request. The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileEventArgs.Profile%2A> property during the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileModule.Personalize> event to specify a custom user profile. If, when the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileModule.Personalize> event completes, the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileEventArgs> parameter of the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileEventHandler> has its <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileEventArgs.Profile%2A> property set to a value that’s not `null`, then the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileModule> uses the value of the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileEventArgs.Profile%2A> property in the current <xref:System.Web.HttpContext>.
> [!NOTE] > The <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileModule> does not set the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileEventArgs.Profile%2A> property for the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileModule.Personalize> event. The <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileModule> only gets the value of the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileEventArgs.Profile%2A> property when the code in the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileModule.Personalize> event completes. If the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileEventArgs.Profile%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property is not explicitly set by application code during the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileModule.Personalize> event, the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileEventArgs.Profile%2A> property value will be `null`.
## Examples The following code example shows the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileModule.Personalize> event declared in the Global.asax file for an application. The event code loads a user profile based on role membership.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.Profile.ProfileManager.Personalize#12](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Profile.ProfileManager.Personalize/CS/global.asax#12)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Profile.ProfileManager.Personalize#12](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Profile.ProfileManager.Personalize/VB/global.asax#12)]
